key_channel_insights.line_content: 89.8 % of HX itineraries were priced higher on OTAs last week, averaging a 9 % premium.
MSE undercut the website on 51.6 % of itineraries and was never higher, signalling consistent downward leakage.
GDS showed higher fares in 85.6 % of cases, with a 5 % average premium and very limited parity (4.7 %).

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTAs priced above HX.com on 89.8 % of itineraries last week, carrying a 9 % average premium.
‘OTA Higher’ share fell 3 ppts WoW while ‘OTA Lower’ more than doubled to 5.1 %.
Far-out bookings still show the steepest premium (16 %) but also the largest WoW improvement (-7 ppts in overpriced share).

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: ‘OTA Higher’ at 89.8 % (-3 ppts WoW) with a steady 9 % markup keeps revenue risk high.
‘OTA Lower’ climbed to 5.1 %, offering 30–49 % savings where present and eroding direct channel appeal.
Exact fare matches remain below 2 %, limiting perceived price consistency.
Website fare missing in 3.2 % of OTA records, stable month-on-month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 91.1 % of short-haul itineraries are higher on OTAs with a 9 % premium; little weekly movement.
‘OTA Higher’ dipped to 88 % yet the premium rose to 10 %; when lower, OTAs undercut by 35 %.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 91.4 % higher-priced incidence, though premium (9 %) slightly trails far-out non-HK routes.
Higher-priced share at 88.4 % but with a larger 10 % markup; parity (3.6 %) triples HK levels.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 92.7 % overpriced with a 6 % premium; undercut cases are rare (2.7 %) yet deep (-49 %).
83.3 % overpriced, 16 % premium; overpriced share fell 7.3 ppts WoW, showing traction in distribution control.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE priced below HX.com on 51.6 % of itineraries and never higher.
Lower fares on 56.5 % of long-haul and 61.5 % of far-out searches, both up ~9–10 ppts WoW.
87.5 % of HK-origin quotes were cheaper on MSE, far exceeding the 18 % for non-HK origins.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 51.6 % lower-priced share (+3.1 ppts WoW), although average discount is marginal (-0.06 %).
Website fare was found in 100 % of MSE queries last week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 47.1 % lower, 52.9 % parity; undercut frequency eased 2 ppts WoW.
56.5 % lower (+8.9 ppts WoW), overtaking parity and squeezing margins.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 87.5 % lower, only slight WoW improvement (-1.7 ppts).
18 % lower yet up 8.6 ppts WoW; parity still dominant at 82 %.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity leads (52.7 %) with 47.3 % lower; leakage manageable in near-term demand.
61.5 % lower (+10 ppts WoW, +12 ppts MoM) threatens early-booking revenue.

gds_highlights.line_content: 86 % of itineraries priced higher than HX.com, averaging a 5 % premium.
Long-haul (7 % premium) and far-out (11 % premium) show the widest gaps.
HK origins 90 % higher with a 7 % premium, topping non-HK routes.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 85.6 % higher-priced share (+1 ppt WoW) with a 5 % average markup.
Exact matches occurred on just 4.7 % of itineraries.
5.6 % lower share carries a steep 30 % discount when it appears.
Only 4.2 % of website fares were absent in GDS, down 0.6 ppt WoW.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 87 % higher with a 3 % premium; share climbed 3 ppts WoW.
83 % higher with a 7 % premium, though higher-priced share dipped 3 ppts WoW.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 90 % higher, 7 % premium; 7.7 % lower cases average a 30 % markdown.
81 % higher, 2 % premium; undercutting limited to 2.7 % of itineraries.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 88.7 % higher with a 2 % premium; undercuts 3.3 % but deep (-46 %).
77 % higher yet at an 11 % premium; 10.6 % lower fares average a 19 % discount.
